page.title: 04OFFA'S DYKE.
page.content:
AFTER THE 5TH CENTURY THE WELSH PRINCES CAME UNDER INCREASING PRESSURE FROM THE INCOMING GERMANIC PEOPLE. HOWEVER FEW INROADS WERE MADE INTO THE WELSH PENINSULA ITSELF. DURING THE 8TH CENTURY KING OFFA THE GREAT OF MERCIA CONSTRUCTED AN EARTHERN FRONTIER DYKE TO MAKE A DEFINITE BOUNDARY BETWEEN THE TERRITORIES OF THE MERCIANS AND THOSE OF THE WELSH. THIS CONSTITUTED THE FIRST WELSH BORDER.
IT WAS INITIALLY SUPPOSED THAT THE DYKE WAS INTENDED AS A MILITARY AND DEFENSIVE WORK AIMED AT KEEPING THE WELSH OUT. THIS WAS A PRIMA FACIE PLAUSIBLE CONCLUSION TO REACH SINCE THE DYKE IS STILL VERY IMPRESSIVE IN SIZE IN SOME SURVIVING PARTS. IN FACT IT WAS PROBABLY THE RESULT OF MERCIAN AND WELSH COMPROMISE AND INTENDED TO DELINEATE A COMMON BORDER - THEREFORE
